Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Delayed toxicity of cyclophosphamide on the bladder of DBA / 2 and C57BL / 6 female mouse .

Let's think step by step.

1. Cyclophosphamide: It is an anticancer drug, and its delayed toxicity on the bladder is the focus of the paragraph. Therefore, it can be considered a "Drug" entity, but since it is causing a toxicity, it can also be considered a "Disease Causing Agent" or simply a "Disease" entity.

2. DBA / 2 and C57BL / 6: These are strains of mice used in the study. They are not diseases, but they can be considered "Subject" entities since they are the ones undergoing the toxicity caused by cyclophosphamide.

3. Female mouse: This is the species and gender of the subject animals in the study. It is not a disease, but it can also be considered a "Subject" entity.

4. Delayed toxicity: This is the condition or effect caused by the cyclophosphamide on the bladder of the female mice. It is the "Disease" entity in the paragraph.

5. Bladder: This is the specific organ affected by the delayed toxicity. It is also a "Body Part" or "Anatomical Structure" entity.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Disease.
1. Delayed toxicity: This is the disease entity in the paragraph, specifically the toxic condition affecting the bladder of the female mice due to cyclophosphamide treatment.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| Delayed toxicity of cyclophosphamide on the bladder of DBA / 2 and C57BL / 6 female mice |

1. Cyclophosphamide: It is a specific chemical entity mentioned in the paragraph. It is an alkylating chemotherapeutic agent used to treat various types of cancer.
